description: After the Burning War, many survivors were turned into murderous beasts. Now, they are attacking innocent villagers in Shenan with only the noble Lord Darius as their savior and hope. But the Sinclarian Empire will prove the be a greatest enemy than the beasts. When Darius refuses to pay tribute to the Duke of York and their vile priests, he will lose something more valuable than his own life.
name: Part 1

description: The night before the major duel with Dougal Jeremy is visited by a succubus, the same one that used to visit him in his dreams as a child. The Succubus has come to help Jeremy stop the deaths of all the Aquarians the next day, taking him to a party in the heavens to stop Aquaris from fulfilling his goal. Nilson and Jeremy devise a way to defeat Dougal in the battle the next day, resulting in Dougal having his head removed by a piano. Nils is finally getting her wish of moving into a castle.
name: Chapter headings for old novels-Part Two

description: As a dare, Aquarius decides to kill all those born under his zodiac sign, which includes Aunt Lotte and Jeremy. With death looming over Aunt Lotte, she requests for nephews Jeremy and Douglas to come to the castle to set the inheritance in order. Unbeknowingly to Jeremy, the sole owner of the MacConner castle will be inherited by the winner of a duel to the death. Nilson, knowing that she will be able to live in the castle if Jeremy inherits it, forces Jeremy to stay and fight his homicidal bully of a cousin Dougal. To help Jeremy win the duel, Nilson trains Jeremy to fight using a selection of groceries. By the end of the day, Jeremy chooses a fish as his weapon of choice against Douglas' sword... Before going to bed, Jeremy attempts to write a letter to Nilson expressing his undying hidden love for her.
name: Chapter headings for old novels Part One

description: Kate's issue, we are taken on a journalistic view of the relationship between Jeremy and Nilson. Kate finds Jeremy naked in the snow after the castle crashes, having had a fight with Nils she booted him out into the snow where Kate finds him. Kate narrates the story explaining the abusive relationship between Nils and Jeremy and outlining the odd behavior that Jeremy displays with a pig...
name: Throw that old thing away grandma

description: Dealing with the headless body of Dougal is no worry for Nils, attaching a pumpkin head to the body and sitting him at a local bus stop. This arouses the suspicions of a local detective, who meets and ends up fantasizing about Nils while trying to solve the murder of the psychopath. Jeremy meanwhile is being neglected as usual by Nils, his massive sword wound covered only by Gaffa tape, he is forced to set up house with Nils, resulting in a move to hospital where his wounds are tended too. Nils torments him with a naughty nurse outfit, then putting him through a bizarre ritual before opening the castle for a housewarming party.
name: A week in no particular order

description: Fresh from his appearances in Dark Horse Presents, Zone's existence is being questions by those who have encountered him! Who's right- Henry, a reporter for the Daily Ledger who says he has proof positive that Zone exists, or Ultra Violent, a man who thinks Zone is a figment of someone's imagination? This is the story that ties up all the loose ends left dangling at the end of Zone's runs in Threat! and DHP - and it is not to be missed!

A human sacrifice is prepared for Azzul Gotha, who's pulled one over on the human race for the first time in forty-two thousand years. The battle in Whistler Museum wraps up, leading to next month's all-out zombie-mayhem conclusion and the end of civilization.

A 42,000-year-old necromancer is terrorizing the townspeople of Whistler, Massachusetts, but that's the least of their problems. Azzul Gotha's ancient debt to the worm gods is at last paid, and the final showdown in the cemetery is enough to raise the dead in this conclusion to the first ZombieWorld story.

name: Monster Man- Hero of the Beach

description: The rat plague is under control in New York City, but there are signs of an entirely different sort of hungry vermin in the subways of New York. A homeless Vietnam vet is the only one who's seen what's really happening underground, but the path to the surface is plagued with monsters, as Bob Fingerman (Minimum Wage) and Tommy Lee Edwards (Moon Knight) continue their epic tale of death in the Big Apple.

Follow Mayor Germani as he promotes his success in quelling the rat plague! Keep your fingers crossed as wacky Vietnam vet-turned-wino Vince, hacks his way through his former slum mates with a rusty steak knife! Beware the Subway of Horror! For those loyal fans who have followed the exploits of ZombieWorld to date, this issue fulfills all of your undead dreams.

Repent and cast away sin, fair reader, for the end is here! Zombies are overwhelming New York City! With the mayor incapable of protecting the citizens of the Big Apple, the people exercise their right to bear arms. Will the freshly sown seeds of love between Jeff and Marisol survive the withering zombie assault? Will toddler's clothes save Abe and Ruthie's marriage? Can Vince convince the police of the threat in time to save the world?

The 42,000-year-old sorceror from Mike Mignola and Pat McEown's ZombieWorld: Champion of the Wormsreturns, and this time his sights are set on London. With a plan to build a giant underground structure to call up the gods of hell, Azzul Gotha needs only one thing more to become the undead king of the world--his queen, Rebecca Dean, who's under the protection of the ancient warrior Killcrop, revived to destroy Gotha and his zombie hordes. A wild and grotesque zombie tale is about to unfold in the four-issue ZombieWorld: The Tree of Death, as Dark Horse teams acclaimedMarshal Law writer Pat Mills with J Deadstock, one of the most dangerous and bizarre artists on the face of the earth.

The demons start appearing in London, as the zombie apocalypse heats up. The Killcrop leads his damsel in distress through the corpse-clogged streets, while in the museum the fearless zombie hunters discover a book that might help against these flesh-munching bastards. The best part is that the writer of the book, though dead for the past hundred years, will probably be available for comment before too long. Join Pat Mills (Marshal Law) and J. Deadstock (murderer of many lesser artists) for the craziest horror comic you're ever gonna find.

Azzul Gotha has captured his bride, Rebecca Dean, just in time for the arrival of Aggrom the Jackal Demon, who's come to witness the nuptials. In the words of Alice: "Aggrom eats only decaying or defiled flesh, suffocating its victims in the mud of its own excrement before devouring them. We must worship him, Rebecca--as a celebration of foulness and decay . . . without which we humans are incomplete."

This is it zombie fans: the knock-down, drag-out fight you've been waiting for! In this corner is Azzul Gotha, backed up by the Demon Gods of Hyperborea and an army of zombies. And in this corner, our team of zombie hunters, aided by a chainsaw weilding psychopath. The fate of the world hangs in the balance, and the out come is far from certain! Pat Mills and J. Deadstock bring us the final chapter in the goriest, scariest ZombieWorld tale to date!
Every year the Mathieson estate in Connecticut is the site of a family Christmas reunion, but this year the whole family's coming home for the holidays.
name: One-Shot

description: A little late for Valentine's, ZombieWorld coughs up its first love story with the help of horrormeister Kelley Jones. Eat Your Heart Out tells the story of a man who'll let nothing stand between him and the girl of his dreams -- even her demise. "Till death do us part" is only half of this guy's vows to his beloved, in a book which lets Kelley Jones go further than Batman or evenThe Hammer ever let him go before. For connoisseurs of extreme horror, this book will be an oasis in a desert of softcore scares.
name: One-Shot

description: An empty gas tank, a desolate road in rural Georgia, and a missing girl set the wheels in motion for the most unpredictable zombie tale you've ever read. Stephen Blue, winner of a 1993 Xeric Grant for Red River and creator of The Awakening from Image Comics, packs this two-issue story full of dread and surprises, taking a bizarre and suspenseful twist on The Night of the Living Dead.
name: 1 of 2

description: Locked up safe inside from the marauding zombies, Lisa finds herself faced with another threat within the house. Xeric Grant winner and creator of Image Comics' The Awakening, Stephen Blue keeps the terror intense and the surprises coming until the last page of this unique zombie tale.
name: 2 of 2

description: Henry Jones Jr. embarks on a voyage around the world with his parents and his new tutor, Miss Seymour. While Henry Jones, Sr. lectures at some of the world's greatest universities, young Henry learns the lessons that will one day make him the adventurer Indiana Jones. In this issue, he meets Lawrence of Arabia by the pyramids of Egypt and faces one of the great questions of life: if many people have many beliefs, which religion is the true one?
name: Egypt, May 1908

description:
Stoies this Issue are

1. The Jackaroo returns to his watering hole the "Australiana Cafe" gets trown out by security on teh orders of the new owner. When he goes to the owners office to question why he fights and destroys a robot assasin that was left for the owner.

2. Capt' Killer Cates takes on teh mage Carnage. Carnage believes him to be an easy beat but as he unleashes his hell fire Cates opens a dimentional gateway to limbo and traps him.

3.The GA Southern Cross helps out military intelegence as they set a trap for enemy spies by allowing an opportunity for an assasination attempt on the PM to become known with SC and MI laying in wait. After the attempt "seemingly " works Sc tracks the assasins back to an axis sub and takes it out.

4. The Southern Squadron get intel that their fearless leader ( Lt Smith ) is a target of none other than the international assasin "the Barnacle". As they rush to protect and warn her they arrive too late to find that he has made his attempt. An attempt that missed LT Smith and killed her friend and neighbor Sarah. Due to an ongoing practicle joke by youths in teh neighborhood hers and Sarah's names are often switched on the unit numbers and buzzers of their secuity building.
name: First Birthday Issue

description: Indiana Jones and his cousin Frank head south of the New Mexico border for a little excitement. But Indy had something else in mind other than finding himself surrounded by Pancho Villa's men and being sentenced to die!
name: Mexico, March 1916

description: BRITISH EAST AFRICA, September 1909. Indy the Lion Hunter! Indiana Jones finds himself on safari with Teddy Roosevelt to collect specimens for the Smithsonian. While hinting the elusive Fringe-Eared zoryx. Indy must decide if he agrees with Roosevelt's view on "animal conservation".
name: British East Africa, September 1909

description: British East Africa, September 1909. In the conclusion of this two-part tale, death stalks Indy in the form of a hungry lion. Indy, with the help of his new friend Meto, has found the oryx for Teddy Roosevelt, but will he live to tell the news?
name: British East Africa, September 1909

description: Jeremy does all he can to escape by writing letters to Nilson, meanwhile the stalker is torturing him. Aunt lottie lets loose that she will give Jeremy another chance to prove himself, but this was the last time. Nilson and Kate manage to track Jeremy down and rescue him from the zookeeper, unveiling her "documentary" which is about Jeremy.
name: Revoking my RSL Membership Part 2

description: The battle of the ages concludes in an extra-sized issue! The heroes regroup for a final showdown with Klarion and the Agenda, but it's hardly a kiddie fight. The Witch Boy has a surprise planned with the villains he's collected, but if that fails, the Contessa has an ace up her sleeve that may surprise even Klarion! And there's one last twist at the end that will make a lasting impression on Young Justice!
name: Sins of Youth: The Stunning Conclusion!

description: Verdun, September 1916. Indiana Jones, now a soldier in the Belgian army, finds himself on courier duty, traveling to the front lines of the most horrifying battle of World War I. As if that weren't dangerous enough, he's soon infiltrating the German lines as a spy...and the Germans don't take spies alive!
name: Verdun, September 1916
Armstrong; The Lost Crown of Genghis Khan!

description: Indy's caught on the wrong side of World War I when he finds himself behind German lines in a French army uniform. Surrounded by the worst carnage of the first World War, he has to save himself before the message he carries can save hundreds of French soldiers!
name: Verdun, September 1916

description: Indy volunteers for Congo duty, figuring anything would be better than the hell of European trench warfare. At least, that's what he thinks until he finds himself surrounded by dying soldiers cut down by disease, crossing the Congo to recover a lost supply of guns!
name: German East Africa, December 1916

description: Indy and Remy have crossed the African contintent, been threatened by disease, and are now in the hands of a German -- but one devoted to their recovery, not their deaths. Albert Schweitzer, the renowned physician and humanitarian, is in Africa trying to save the world's most precious treasure: human lives. Unfortunately, there's a war going on, and the other side doesn't see his value, just his nationality.
name: German East Africa, January 1917

description: It's Indy's first encounter with love. Even though he's got advice from the best experts Vienna has to offer on that subject -- Freud, Jung, and Adler -- he's not prepared for the excitement. He soon finds himself hanging from carriages, scaling walls, risking guard dogs, and avoiding an overprotective governess to be near his beloved Sophie. But Sophie's not only the object of Indy's affections; she's also the daughter of Archduke Ferdinand, the ruler of the Austro-Hungarian Empire.
name: Vienna, November 1908/March 1917

description: Indy's off to Vienna with two unusual spies, hoping to obtain a secret letter that will help them bring an end to the war that is destroying both France and Austria. The new spies may be inept, but they have an advantage Indy can't hope to match... The Empress of Austria is their sister. They're a royal pain, and though he may want to strangle them, Indy has to help keep them alive.
name: Vienna, March 1917

description: Indy embarks on a tour of the Far East, but is distracted from the beauty of the country by the presence of a mysterious stranger. Could this man be a spy or a bomb-carrying revolutionary? Will Indy convince their guide that they are indeed being followed? From the Great Wall of China to the steps of the Meng Jiang Temple, Indy explores the wonders of ancient dynasties, recognizes the value of maintaining "face," and learns a very valuable lesson in balance. And that's just the start of the journey...
name: Peking, March 1910
Jungle Duck; The Giant Robot Robbers

description: BRIT! INVINCIBLE! DONALD! WOLF-MAN! TECH JACKET! The team up of the century! United against the legions of Other-Earth! Will even the combined might of the heroes of the Invincible Universe be enough to defeat the awesome might of The Emperor?!

It's the end of the FF's adventure in the worlds of Fiction! Will there be a happy ending?! Are those wedding bells we hear?! Can it really be that, as the title has it, Johnny Storm Saves Books?! And there's this trick Reed pulls that made our eyes cross. And the big villain who we can't reveal yet because you'll see this before he first appears, oh, he really gets hoist by his own petard! But will the team get back to reality in time to save Billie Lumpkin? All this and a talking badger!
name: Johnny Storm Saves Books

description:
Long before his memories were restored, the X-Man known as Wolverine spent years seeking to unlock the mysteries of his past. Some of those memories were best left forgotten. Join Charles Xavier as he journeys deep into Wolverine's mind on a quest for answers that will shed new light on one of the darkest periods of Logan's life -- his days in the Weapon X program! It's a brand-new look at the horrifying history of Marvel's most prominent mutant! PLUS: Each issue features a 10-page back-up story featuring an important player from Wolverine's past! First up, an untold tale of Wolvie's arch-nemesis, the mutant madman known as Sabretooth!

Synopsis

Part 1, Don't Look Back in Anger

Logan approaches Xavier's School for Gifted Youngsters. In his mind he knows that he has found a place to call home. As he draws nearer, Kitty informs him that the Danger Room is prepped for a practice session. Wolverine bows out of practice in order to have a one-on-one session with Xavier. He muses about how everyone else knows who they are. He, on the other hand, is still searching. Sitting down with Professor Xavier, the two discuss the next possible solution to figuring out where Wolverine came from. Xavier has tried everything. He does have an idea, though. He'd like Wolverine to accompany him into Wolverine's own mind, a dangerous idea, since Xavier will need total trust and cooperation, something hard to come by with someone as capricious as Wolverine is.

Xavier begins the experiment. Once in Wolverine's mind, the two men find themselves trapped in a cubic, stone room. Xavier explains that the walls have been erected by Wolverine himself. Not one to be held back by barriers, Wolverine attempts to rip the walls down. The stone is easy enough, but there is a tougher barrier immediately behind it. Xavier explains that Wolverine's mind isn't so easy to navigate. Wolverine's subconscious must have some things it wants to keep hidden. Wolverine exerts all he has and finally rips through the outer wall. He and Xavier step through the hole to find shards, fragments, of Wolverine's memories: fighting the Hulk, running with wolves, and hanging out with Captain America, among others. Wolverine is stumped, sure that some of the memories must be false since some look to be from ages in the past. Xavier hypothesizes that Wolverine must be older than originally thought, something aided by Wolverine's healing factor. Wolverine can't place many of the memories. Sabretooth steps from the recesses of Wolverine's mind and offers to help.

The two battle, but when Wolverine goes for the kill, he learns that Sabretooth really is just a figment of his mind. Sabretooth then relates a simple story in which he and Wolverine had been on the same team years back. Memories flood and Wolverine sees his abduction at the hands of some goons. He asks where he was taken and Sabretooth shows a large penitentiary-like place. Sabretooth refuses to enter; he's had his fill with the place. Wolverine and Xavier enter and see Wolverine's body in the Weapon X tanks. This story continues in the next issue.

The Recruit

Sabretooth approaches an old cabin in the Canadian wilderness. He crumples up an invitation and tries to shake the feeling that he is about to be drafted into some cause. In the cabin, Sabretooth is greeted by a shadowed, bald man. The stranger acknowledges that Sabretooth has a reputation for tracking, a point that led to inviting him in the first place. The stranger then comments on Sabretooth's past, like when he went rogue on a Team X mission or about his father abusing him. The stranger then explains that Sabretooth's many gifts have prepared him for the stranger's program. Sabretooth refuses to think he can do anything worthwhile, but the stranger simply says it is in Sabretooth's hands to prove the world wrong about who he's become. The program, says the stranger, is to help find people. The stranger slides a folder marked "Classified: Weapon X," and explains that Sabretooth knows the person to be located first. Opening the file, Sabretooth sees Wolverine's face and gets angry. He charges the stranger but freezes in mid-stride. The stranger turns out to be Xavier. He wheels himself out of harm's way and puts into Sabretooth's mind that the meeting had never happened. When Sabretooth awakens, he feels as if he's just woken from a bad dream. He leaves, mulling over a though Xavier left in his mind: a war is coming.
name: Part One: Don't Look Back In Anger/The Recruit

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning
New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning
New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

description: As a secret cabal within Heaven and Hell conspires to manufacture a war, the new Devil-Slayer finds himself besieged by ghouls and surrounded by enemies on all sides. It's a race against time to unravel the Bloodstone conspiracy and stop Operation: Xenogenesis before it's too late for all of mankind, in this terrifying, brutal reinterpretation of the Devil-Slayer by acclaimed horror novelist Brian Keene and rising star Chris Samnee (DAREDEVIL: BLOOD OF THE TARANTULA)!
name: In The Garden

description: Warren Ellis tears back the curtain and shines full light on the seductively mysterious Anna Mercury in his all-new color series! Well, it certainly did seem like a job well done, and she thought she'd won this round. Anna Mercury returns home, secure in the success of her mission and believing she has saved Sheol from New Ataraxia's awesome weapon, The Cutter. Unfortunately, she was wrong. Anna and her command have underestimated how severely damaged the societies are, and she must now return to that mad and beautiful world to prevent the cities' mutually assured destruction!

name: The Crown Jewels Affair; Grandma Duck:The Willing Model; The Whole Herd of Help
The Fountain of Laughs; Two-Way Luck; Seeing The Blight

description:
• BUFFALO GIRLS
  • CLOWN STORY
  • THE GARDEN OF EARTHLY DELIGHTS
  • ALLYSA (THE UNTAMED)
  • BABY OIL
name: Coven Of Angels
The Abominable Snowduck; Coin of the Realm
Ashcan

person_credits.name: Mike Manley
person_credits.role: writer, editor, penciler, letterer, inker, cover

volume.name: Action Planet Comics, Philly Ashcan Edition

description:
A cover by Joseph Michael Linsner featuring the Incredible Hulk and Amazing Spider-Man starts this action-packed benefit book with a cornucopia of talent, including a new story by Stan Lee! Plus, two new stories featuring the Incredible Hulk (by William Loebs, Dave Simons and Armando Gil) and Spider-Man (by Ron Marz and Dan Jurgens)! Also featured is a new story from Michael Avon Oeming, and an unprecedented collaboration of Paul Dini and James Owen. Published in conjunction with Century Comics, this book showcases the industry's top talent - all of whom have dedicated their time to this extraordinary volume!

Stories:

  • The Day the Superheroes Quit! by Stan Lee, Joseph Michael Lisner
  • Dance by C. B. Cebulski, Joao Lemos
  • The Final Ka-boom!?! by Al Nickerson, Joe Staton, Nick Cuti
  • The Dreamland Chronicles by Scott Christian Sava
  • The Mice Templar by Michael Avon Oeming, Bryan J. L. Glass
  • Dirty, Pretty, Everlasting Things. by John "JB" May, Jerry Hinds, Danny Jalil
  • I Know Everything by J. C. Vaughn, Brendon & Brian Fraim
  • Hypothetical Cerebus and the Necronmicon Monks by T. Casey Brennan, Dave Sim
  • S.A.S.E. (Send Another Submissions Editor) by C. B. Cebulski, Rob Guillory
  • The Sacrifice by Michael Avon Oeming, Victor Santos
  • My Hero by Ron Marz, Dan Jurgens, Al Vey
  • Puppets by William Messner Loebs, Troy Hickman, Dave Simons, Armando Gil
  • Chips Wilde:The Wild One by Dick Ayers
  • Singapore Sling: Comes the Creaper! by Tom DeFalco, Jerry Hinds, Din
  • For the Love of Barbara Allen by Roy Thomas, Dick Giordano
  • Mr. Oblivion by Dan Wickline, Desiree Rincon
  • My Hand to God: True Tales of Horror from the Convention Trail by Mark Waid, Rodolfo Migliari
  • Ida Red in: No Rodeo Dough by Paul Dini, David Alvarez
  • Spot by Frank Shaskus, Julio Molina-Muscara
  • My Favorite Super Hero by John Gallagher
  • PVP (Player Vs. Player) by Scott Kurtz

Pinups by Trevor Hairsine, Tone Rodriguez, Frank Cho, Jack Katz, Christian N. St. Pierre, Terry and Rachel Dodson, Adam Warren, Ken Branch, Steve Rude
name: Actor Comics Presents

description: Collects Marvel Comics Presents (1988) #64-71.
name: TPB

volume.name: Wolverine and Ghost Rider in Acts of Vengeance

description:
Stories Include:


The Outlaw Breed!
The Warning
The Gun-Barrel Kid Escapes
The Black Stallion!
The Badmen!
The Man Who Wouldn't Fight!
name: The Outlaw Breed!

description: Collects 5 graphic novellas; The Panty Killer, We Are Seven, Crumpet Ladies, Royal Sable and Pretenders.
name: The Actus Box

description: The Black Terror and many of the heroes who were trapped in the Urn of Pandora are simply trying to make sense of the new world around them. The are in huge battles with zombie like copies of their old ally American Crusader and they are in a desperate search to find the friends they lost. As well as try and find the friends they had in the past. This world is darker that the one they knew and they fight hoping to make the United States and the world a better place.
name: The Superpowers Vs. The Superpowers: The Black Terror Goes To Washington

description: Abe, Johann, and Kate discover that their old enemies have joined forces, threatening to shake the very foundations of the world.

first_appearance_teams.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

team_credits.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

description:
This issue's theme: What's in the box? What's in the box that Freddy and Mouse have discovered in their lost kingdom, and what's in the box that Bigby and Fly have delivered back to Frau Totenkinder in Fabletown? What's in the box being buried up at the Farm, and finally, how is that causing everything to come loose in Fabletown and beyond? The answers aren't what you'll expect in part 2 of this 5-part story.

Also in this issue, check out the second chapter of a 5-part back-up tale by Peter Gross, which began in FABLES #77.

Pinocchio, Flycatcher and Blue have just picked up comics and candy. They talk about girls and Red Riding Hood. They ask Blue where his trumpet is at since he usually plays before they read. He tells them his hand is still healing. Seeing that his hand is actually green, Pinocchio and Flycatcher suggest he see a doctor right away.

Geppetto tells Frau that a broadcast box has been opened in his old empire. By destroying his empire, they've actually unleashed something worse. The boxes contain old powers and took centuries and armies to lock away. That power that has been awoken is aware that some of his power was stolen and bound up in a witching cloak. He plans on unbinding it and punishing those that warped his powers.

Bigby and Flycatcher retrieve a box that Totenkinder described to them and Flychatcher transports them back to her apartment. Bufkin brings the witching cloak to Beauty but he says it became tatters as soon as he picked it up. As Beauty begins to scold him, there appears to be an earthquake. Putting Bufkin on clean up duty, she heads upstairs. To her surprise, Grimble tells here that there wasn't any quakes up there. She begins to argue with him saying he needs to do his job as the security officer while deep below, Baba Yaga seems to be free.

In the hospital, Blue is told that the latest surgery was finally a success. It seems that each time they kept missing a thread from the witching cloak that was infecting his wound. Blue tells the doctor that his arm feels weird but is told that it's just phantom pain. Blue's arm had to be amputated. There wasn't any other way to get to what was trying to kill him. The arm was pretty much all rotted with gangrene. He figures he might've been able to try to reattach it since that would've been one "for the record books."
name: Boxes: Chapter Two Of The Dark Ages

description:
The story opens with a young cloaked woman holding a sword, clad in armor bearing wings. "I believe there's a place where the restless souls wander. Burdened by the weight of their own sadness, they cannot enter Heaven. And so they wait, trapped between our world and the next, endlessly searching for a way to rid themselves of their pain. In hope that somehow, someday, they will be reunited with the ones they love." explains the young woman as the scene skips to the past. 
 
City of Angels - October 29th - La Noche De San Lucas.
 
A crow flies over as a gang has a man and his son bound on a dock facing the waterfront. As one of the gang members begins filming the ordeal, the father begs for his son's life. His pleas however fall upon deaf ears as his son is murdered. Immediately afterwords the man is shot 3 times by the de-facto leader, the two bodies are then dumped into the ocean. As the father and son sink to the bottom, the fathers dying view is of a crow, seemingly flying up through the depths and out into the night.
name: The Crow City Of Angels

description: The mystery of Daedalus deepens, and it becomes increasingly clear that he is somehow tied to Zee's past. Meanwhile, the corporation's stranglehold on the city tightens, and more street racers are being hunted and executed. As they close in, Zee makes a fatal mistake!
name: Ghost Of The Wasteland, Part 3

description: True fact- fabled pirate Jean Lafitte spent his last years not on the high seas, but in Texas. Guess who his best friend was? Jim Bowie. What adventures must a swashbuckling corsair and an American frontiersman have had together in the Old West? It's Deadwood with pirates, man. Pirates!

• THE CROW and OCTOBER
  • SHADOWPLAY
  • DEAD TIME: SPIRIT GUIDE
  • SHE SMILES IN PAIN AND GLORY
  • FLESH & BLOOD: PICK YOUR NIGHTMARE
  • SPINE OF THE SNAKE
  • WILD JUSTICE: PROLOGUE
  • WAKING NIGHTMARES: GHOSTS
  • THE BOOK OF DREAMS
name: A Cycle Of Shattered Lives

description: Indiana Jones has faced numerous perils, but his battles have always been against external forces. When the attack comes from within, in the form of a deadly fever, Young Indy's mother must decide whether to trust ancient Chinese medical practices or risk waiting for a missionary doctor. It's a race against time and a lesson in maintaining face in this moving conclusion of Indy's adventure in Peking.
name: Peking, March 1910

description: It's always a pleasure to introduce a bright new talent into the comics field, a creator whose powerful visual skills are matched by an assured command of narrative: in short, a true storyteller. Such a talent is Glenn Wong, and Dark Horse is proud to present his first major work, The Young Cynics Club. You'll find no superheroes, monsters, or pin-up girls here; this is a tale of ordinary people, of longtime friends growing up and growing apart. The wry authenticity of Wong's characterizations is underscored by the mature strength of his illustration, reminiscent of the spare elegance of Steve Rude and Jaime Hernandez. Insightful and sentimental, funny and sad, The Young Cynics Club is the first act of a career you won't want to miss.

It's babes and badges! Miyuki and Natsumi are two stunningly beautiful policewomen who are, at heart, a couple of girls who just wanna have fun! When they're not getting themselves into wacky situations, they're busy enforcing the law. They're part Cagney and Lacey, part Thelma and Louise, and part Barbie and Skipper!

They're babes with badges and a souped-up set of wheels! Miyuki and Natsumi are two stunningly beautiful policewomen who are, at heart, a couple of girls who just wanna have fun! When they're not getting themselves into wacky situations, they're busy enforcing the law. They're part Cagney and Lacey, part Thelma and Louise, and part Barbie and Skipper!

On the upper floors of Tokyo's highest high-rises, the residents feel a certain amount of safety from the predators that prey on the "peasants." And so, seemingly without concern, they hang their laundry on their lines and throw caution to the wind. What they didn't bargain on was a bandit so obsessed he'd make the top floors his target -- a prowler with a penchant for silk, silk, SILK PANTIES! It's up to Miyuki and Natsumi to put an end to the panty plunderer and lock him away for good, before all of Tokyo's upper crust are forced to go bottomless!

Officer Nakajima is the loyal beau of lovely policewoman Miyuki -- but is she good enough for him? That's the question Nakajima's father wants answered, and to do it the old man puts Miyuki and her partner Natsumi under surveillance! But Cupid's arrows are unpredictable things, and the outcome is sure to surprise everyone.

Golf is a national obsession in Japan and, like any obsession, it's breeding its own unique brand of crime -- the counterfeiting of country-club memberships! But for every problem there is a solution, in this case a nine-iron-wielding cop who shaves his legs as well as his face! He's Officer Aoi: part-time policeman, part-time golf instructor, full-time transvestite!

In the darkest alleyways of deepest gotham, one image strikes fear into the hearts of criminals -- the image of a fastball comin' for your face! The big city has a new protector, Strikeman, and he's pitching in to keep the streets safe! But his vigilante gig has run afoul of the law, and policewomen Natsumi and Miyuki have been assigned to take him out!

If your widowed father remarried, it would be hard enough to call that woman "mom." But if she were six years younger than you, it would be almost impossible! Unfortunately for Nakajima, that's just what he must do -- or the little tramp refuses to cross the threshold! Unless, of course, he can earn her respect by recovering her stolen automobile!

Someone's cruising the streets of Tokyo in a phony police car, stopping young drivers, and shaking them down for "fines." It's up to Natsumi and Nakajima -- two of Tokyo's finest -- to put an end to the spree, and they've got the resources of the entire outfit to do it! This marks the conclusion to You're Under Arrest!. If you haven't spent an afternoon detained by the babes with badges -- Miyuki and Natsumi -- it's not too late; this final issue is a self-contained, stand-alone story that'll have you flying to the Far East for more!

name: Revenge is a Kind of Wild Justice

description: The man's name is Coffin, and he's the newest member of the Chaos Riders. Last time he rode into town, he took X's left eye as a souvenir. This time around, he's not going to settle for just an eye. X builds toward its inexorable climax -- and a startling revelation about our one-eyed mystery man -- in X #25.
name: Dies Ire!
